author: bergmeister
body:
Steps to reproduce
------------------

Run the install-powershell.ps1 script [here](https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/blob/master/tools/install-powershell.ps1) with the `-Daily` switch (`.\tools\install-powershell.ps1 -Daily`) or just `iex "& { $(irm 'https://aka.ms/install-pscore' ) } -Daily"` for the faint-hearted ;-)


Expected behavior
-----------------

Downloaded PowerShell version from [MyGet]("https://powershell.myget.org/F/powershell-core-daily") is [6.1-preview831](https://ci.appveyor.com/project/PowerShell/powershell-f975h/build/v6.1.0-rc.831) or higher

Actual behavior
---------------

Downloaded PowerShell version from [MyGet]("https://powershell.myget.org/F/powershell-core-daily") is stuck at 6.1.0-preview-761

Environment data
----------------

<!-- provide the output of $PSVersionTable -->

```powershell
> $PSVersionTable
Name                           Value
----                           -----
PSVersion                      6.1.0
PSEdition                      Core
GitCommitId                    6.1.0
OS                             Microsoft Windows 10.0.17134
Platform                       Win32NT
PSCompatibleVersions           {1.0, 2.0, 3.0, 4.0...}
PSRemotingProtocolVersion      2.3
SerializationVersion           1.1.0.1
WSManStackVersion              3.0
```

comments.author: adityapatwardhan
comments.body: I will have a look at this.

comments.author: adityapatwardhan
comments.body:
This should be fixed now.

```PowerShell
PS> iex "& { $(irm 'https://aka.ms/install-pscore' ) } -Daily"
VERBOSE: Destination: C:\Users\adityap\AppData\Local\Microsoft\powershell-daily
VERBOSE: Daily package found. Name: powershell-win-x64-win7-x64; Version: 6.1.0-rc-837
VERBOSE: Change icon to disambiguate it from a released installation
```

comments.author: bergmeister
comments.body: Thanks, I can confirm the fix :)

comments.author: bergmeister
comments.body: @adityapatwardhan Just a reminder that the daily build has not been updated since February as we discussed last week and is still on `6.2.0-dailypreview4.12015`.

comments.author: adityapatwardhan
comments.body: I will have a look at it this week.

comments.author: adityapatwardhan
comments.body:
@bergmeister - Can you give this a try:

```PowerShell
Install-Package powershell-win-x64-win7-x64 -Version 6.2.0-dailyrc1-19313 -Source https://powershell.myget.org/F/powershell-core-daily/api/v3/index.json
```

comments.author: bergmeister
comments.body: Thanks, it is fixed now, locally I get the `6.2.0-dailyrc1.19498` now when running the `.\tools\install-powershell.ps1 -Daily` script :)

title: Daily builds not published any more in the last months to MyGet
